hl.seg: Supporting the French proposal

After the meeting, speaking to representatives of the press, Mushahid Husain Syed said that the committee welcomed the proposal given by France, in which Israel would call an immediate ceasefire and allow humanitarian work among the affected people of Gaza.
Calling the Israeli attacks on Palestine a crime against humanity, he said that all countries should derogate these attacks.
Mushahid Husain made the double standards of the countries of the world a target of his attack, and asked, "Why are those who speak against terrorism quiet about the Israeli attacks on Palestine?"
The chairman of the standing committee of external affairs in the senate also targeted the leaders of Muslim nations who were taking a quiet stance on the matter of Palestine.

He said that the committee expressed hope that the newly elected American President, Barack Obama, would speak to the Muslim world within his first 100 days in office to bridge the gulf forming between America and the Muslim world.

Mushahid Husain Syed said that the gap formed between the Muslim world and the West should be filled by taking not only sudden steps but also by solving longstanding issues like Kashmir and Palestine.
The minister of foreign affairs, Malik Imad, told the committee that he was going to Saudi Arabia to attend the meeting of the foreign ministers of the governments of Islamic countries.

This sudden meeting was called as a result of Israeli attacks on Palestine. He said that he was aware of the Palestinian matter and at present, the government was in contact with the premiers of other countries.
The Minister of State for Foreign Affairs has said that the issue of Palestine should be resolved in accordance with the resolutions of the United Nations.
Two journalists from Arab countries also joined the conference, and they told about the latest situation in Palestine.
In Islamabad, students of the International University protested against the Israeli attacks on Palestine.
The protesters were holding banners and placards, of which had anti-Israel slogans written on them.

hl.seg: Abstention from dieting in order to avoid Flu.

doc.seg: This research from the American Scientists has come up after the experiments on rats.
It has been proven by experiments that rats put on diets with fewer calories were more prone to the Flu virus.
Research has proven the old myth of fasting during fever wrong.
According to scientists, one should eat a lot during fever.

The researchers from Michigan State University say that the rats that were dieting were not as able to resist the infection, and their chances of dying had increased. Whereas rats on normal diets had better resistance against the Flu virus.
According to Professor Elizabeth Gardner, people who diet will not be affected with flu sooner but they will need more time to recover from it.
She also said that those people who receive the flu vaccine should also avoid dieting during the winter months.

hl.seg: 'First nuclear experiment was done in 1990'

doc.seg: Thomas Reid, who has worked in the Lever National Laboratory in America as a weapon designer, has written this book with the help of the former director of technical intelligence at Los Alamos national laboratory, Dani Stillman.

This book was titled "Nuclear Express: Political History of the Bomb and Its Proliferation," and both writers have claimed that whichever country first made a nuclear bomb either stole the nuclear secrets of another country or had the support of another nuclear power.
In an interview with U.S. news agencies, Thomas Reid said that in 1990 during Benazir Bhutto's rule, China experimented with Pakistan's first nuclear bomb.
Thomas Reid said that for many reasons, he believes that China had experimented with Pakistan's first nuclear bomb.
The reasons include the design of the bomb and some information retrieved during talks with the Chinese scientists.
He further added that this was the reason that in 1998 in a span of only two weeks and three days, Pakistan was able to carry out nuclear experiments in response to Indian nuclear experiments.
Thomas Reid reminds us that in 1961 Russia suddenly carried out a nuclear experiment and besides possessing the bomb for a long time, it took 17 days for America to carry out nuclear experiments.
He said further that in May 1998, the atom bomb that Pakistan tested was made with care, and Pakistani scientists were completely trusted for it.
When Thomas Reed was asked if China supplied atomic technology to Pakistan, he replied that India is a mutual enemy of Pakistan and China.
He said evidence was also present that Dr. Abdul Qadir Khan had used the Chinese model. Later the Libyan documents confirmed this.
Another question was about mutual nuclear experiment. He replied that Anees Sonway openly performed a nuclear experiment in the desert of Nevada for Britain.
He said Israel was predicted to have access to the results of this experiment.
Thomas Reeds was also asked if China was continuing nuclear proliferation.
On this Thomas Reeds said that China has been supplying raw material, instructions and the design to an Iranian nuclear facility in Asfahan.
Apart from this, China has also provided Iran with an enrichment plant in Kheeraj.
He said that China had been providing nuclear technology to Iran, Rome, Pakistan, Egypt, Libya and Yemen via North Korea.

hl.seg: Protest Against the Removal of Journalists

doc.seg: On Tuesday the organization of journalists RIUJ held protests in front of the Islamabad Press Club against media owners and the government about the news channel and newspapers removing many of their employees.

Speaking to the protesters, senior member of Pakistan's biggest journalist organization, Federal Union of Journalists, C.R. Shamsi said that the politicians used to protest with us until yesterday on the streets, today they have become rulers and are sitting in the parliament. Fearing a certain lobby of the media owners, they are not doing anything for the rights of the journalists.

He said that the newspaper owners who speak of human rights have made their offices punishment houses and beggar camps, where despite earning millions of rupees per year, the workers are given meager wages and by removing hundreds of them, they are killing them economically.

An example of this is in front of us of the worker of a private TV channel, Channel 5, in Lahore, who committed suicide over not getting his salary for four months. And even today, due to being unfairly removed or not getting salaries for months, many workers are leading very difficult lives.
He said that there should be firm steps taken against the TV and newspaper owners, and the journalists should put a protest camp in front of the parliament to get their rights.
C.R. Shamsi criticized the governor of Punjab, Salman Taseer, saying that employees were removed from his Urdu Newspaper "Aaj Kal" staff without prior notice.
Wheras Junah daily, Khabrein daily, Channel 5, Burns Plus TV and Aaj TV have removed dozens of workers.

Speaking to the protestors, the General Secretary of PUFJ said that today, throughout the country, journalist organizations are observing a black day against the removal of journalists and newspaper workers, whereas journalists will go to the parliamentary session wearing black bands on their arms to get back their rights.
According to Mazhar Abbas, in 50% of the Pakistani newspapers and TV channels the workers and journalists were being exploited, where they work without any agreement.

He said that until now, more than 200 journalists and workers have been removed from newspapers and TV channels, while it is being feared that the owners will remove hundreds more in the present year, making an excuse of the present financial crisis.

Mazhar Abbas said that the journalist movement will continue until removed employees are reinstated, newspaper wages fixed by the Seventh Wage board award are enforced, and the salaries owed by TV channels and newspaper workers is paid.

hl.seg: 3.5 million users affected by virus

doc.seg: A virus first detected in October 2008 is known by many names: Configure, Down and Up and Kido.
Microsoft has come out with a patch to deal with this virus, but still some 3.5 million computers and memory sticks were affected by the virus.
Experts say that the number of affected computers may be considerably greater.
To deal with this, users should use Microsoft's MS08067 patch.
According to Microsoft, this virus, which infected millions of computers, locates the "services.exe" file in Windows and then inserts itself into its code.
After that, the virus turns into a DLL file in the Windows System folder.
It also renames this file,
then changes settings in the Windows registry.
After activation, this virus creates a program which connects to an http server and changes the system restore point.
It then downloads files from the maker's website.
According to Microsoft, this virus has infected computers all over the world.
These countries include China, Brazil, Russia, India, the United States and Great Britain.

hl.seg: Dera Bugti: Blast Over the Gas Pipeline

doc.seg: Police officials say that the 18 inches diameter pipeline going from Lui gas field to peer koh was blasted.
This pipeline goes towards the Sui plant.
Meanwhile, Sarbaz Baloch, presenting himself as a representative of the banned Baloch Republican army has accepted the responsibility of the blast on behalf of his organization over the telephone.
It is the fourth pipeline that has been blasted in four days.
On Friday an 18 inch diameter pipeline was blasted in Dera Allahyar whose repair work was continued till Sunday morning.
General Manager of Sui Southern Gas in Quetta, Mushtaq Siddiqui has told that supply from this pipeline will resume in the afternoon.
This pipeline reached Quetta through Sibbi.

Quetta: Zyarat and other surrounding areas have an extreme shortage of natural gas for three days. On one side the snowfall continues and the temperature has dropped below freezing; the other side is where the stoves and heaters have gone cold.
In addition, there was a bomb blast in a motorcycle in Mal Mandi in the city of Dera Bugti. But according to the police, there was no fatality as a result of this blast.

hl.seg: Administrator for Jamat-ud-Dawa

doc.seg: The headquarter of Jamat-ud-Dawa, Tayyaba Center, is almost 25 kilometers away from Lahore near Mureedkay.
This center has a hospital, a school and also a hostel for students.

The law minister of Punjab, Rana Sanaullah Khan, says that the assignment of a superintendent in the Jamat-ud-Dawa center came into being so that the work of the welfare organizations present there is not disturbed.

According to Khalid Waleed, the son-in-law of Chief of Jamat-ud-Dawa Hafiz Saeed, qualified government official Khaqan Babar is appointed as an administrator to monitor the hospital, schools and other welfare organizations located in the center. Although, according to them, there has also been an increase in the police staff.

The Security Council of the United Nations has placed restrictions on Jamat-ud-Dawa after which Pakistan's federal government did an operation against Jamat-ud-Dawa in the entire country. Many leaders were placed under house arrest, including Ameer Hafiz Saeed. The assignment of an administrator in the Tayyaba center from the government of Punjab was also part of the series of actions by the federal government against Jamat-ud-Dawa.
Khaqan Babar is related to DMG (District Management Group).

Hafiz Khalid Waleed has said that Lahore division commissioner Khusro Parvez Khan came to the Tayyaba Center on Sunday with the police and civil authorities and inspected several parts of the center. Khalid Waleed has disapproved of placement of an administrator from the government in the Jamat-ud-Dawa Center. It is also said that earlier operations of the government have already decreased the number of patients in the hospital and students in the school.

According to a press release by Jamat-ud-Dawa, party chief Hafiz Saeed has written a letter for the General Secretary of United Nations, Ban Ki Mon, and Committee for Taliban, in which a request is made to cancel the restrictions on the party made by the Security Council.
It says in the letter that the one sided decision of the Security Council on banning Jamat-ud-Dawa is unfair. And Jamat-ud-Dawa has no relation with terrorism but it is busy in charitable activities.

hl.seg: Edhi on the aid mission of Gaza.

doc.seg: After going through many steps of receiving permission required to enter Gaza, he has only been successful in reaching Egypt from New York.
He said while talking to BBC Urdu service from Qahira that he has still not reached Gaza because Egypt and Israel have created many obstacles.
He said "It has been eight days since I am here but I still have not received the permission to enter Gaza."
"I am currently in Qahira and hopefully will get permission to go to Gaza."

He explained that: "First I was given only 7 days visa to go to Gaza and later on my insisting, Pakistani officials helped me and had it extended for one month but on this condition that I will go to Gaza only once that is single entry."
He said that he has his son and daughters with him and they want to do charity work in Gaza.
I have brought some money.
A one million dollar check has been given to the Red cross of Egypt and ten thousand dollars in cash has been also given in order to send aid to Gaza.

hl.seg: Four more ministers in the cabinet, total of sixty three

doc.seg: The four new federal ministers include two from the Mutahida Qaumi Movement and two from the Jamiat Ulamae Islam Fazalur Rehman Group.
President Asif Ali Zardari took the oath from the new ministers.
Prime Minister Yousuf Raza Gilani and members of cabinet were also present at the oath-taking ceremony.
After the inclusion of four new ministers to the federal cabinet, the number of federal ministers, state ministers, and advisers has reached a total of sixty-three.
Ministers Farooq Sattar and Babar Ghouri are from MQM, whereas Ministers Azam Swati and Molana Ataur Rehman are from the Jamiat Ulamae Islam Fazalur Rehman Group.
The departments of these ministers have not yet been announced.
Farooq Sattar is the convener of MQM, whereas Babar Ghouri is a senator from MQM whose term will expire on March 10.
Azam Swati was elected as a free senator and is considered to be one of the richest.
Moulana Ata-ur-Rahman is a member of the National Assembly and also Moulana Fazal-ur-Rahman's younger brother.
Remember that four statesmen holding posts in important ministries are not members of the National Assembly.

Note that the cabinet was expanded on November 3, 2008, with 22 new ministers and 18 national ministries. So at that time it was thought that the members of MQM would also be included but due to disagreements on the distribution of the ministries, MQM stayed away.

hl.seg: Bolochistan, Blasted Pipeline

doc.seg: According to police, this is a 18-inch diameter pipeline which connects different wells of Parekoh and meets the Suyi gas pipeline. This was blasted by unidentified men in the early morning.
Apart from this, yesterday, well number 3 near Suyi had been totally destroyed by a blast and a gas pipeline near Dera-allayar was also damaged due to a blast.
Militant organization Baloch republican army's spokeperson, Saryaz Baluch, accepted the responsibility for these blasts on the behalf of his organization.
As 2009 began, there was an increase in violent incidents in Baluchistan.
This month, until now, several gas pipelines have been blasted. Attacks on trains and on people belonging to the Punjab region have also increased.

Though the Prime Minister of Baluchistan, Nawab Aslam Rayisani, has expressed concern over such activities and ordered the police to exchange information from intelligence agencies, stopping such incidents has not been possible yet.

hl.seg: $819 billion economic revival package approved

doc.seg: No member of the Republican party voted for President Obama's plan.
Members of the Republican Party said that the economic plan is very expensive and will not prove effective.
240 votes were cast in favor of this package in the members assembly whereas 160 were cast against it.
This economic revival plan will be presented next week in the Senate where the ruling Democratic party has very little majority.
Concern is being expressed that great opposition from the Republican Party may make it difficult to obtain Senate approval.
After the approval of economic revival plan, Barack Obama insisted that this important plan should not cause political disagreement.
The president said that this plan, which hoped would be enacted by next month, will prove to make a peaceful atmosphere in the country and enhance the American economy.
According to this plan, the public will be forgiven of loans from $275 billion to $540 billion for roads, bridges, 10,000 schools, unemployment benefits and research for new technology.

BBC writer Richard Luster has said in Washington that Barack Obama intended to introduce a new political culture by eliminating political disagreements, but discussion about this economic package has once again made politicians sore.
Republican members of the senate called the proposed bill a waste of government money, and said that it will not help in creating new employment opportunities.
They instead stressed the bill passed by their own party, in which more importance was given to tax cuts.
They said that more employment opportunities could be formed with less capital through their bill.
They said that compared to constructive plans, more employment opportunities could be formed through tax cuts.

hl.seg: Bitterness between Israeli President and Turkish Prime Minister

doc.seg: Nearly screaming, Recep Tayyip Erdogan told the Israeli president that the blood of many humans were spilled in Gaza, and it saddened him to see that people could watch this armed killing from Israel and clap in agreement.

Mr. Erdogan said that ""I believe that you are using such words to publicly ease your guilty conscience. But you killed those people, and I will not forget those children who were killed near the shore.""
Simon said that Gaza's calamity is not due to Israel, but rather Hamas, who have established a dangerous dictatorship over there.
A BBC journalist from Davos said that he had never seen such a scene in an global economic forum before.
However, Erdogan later stated that he respected the aged Israeli president, falsely claiming that he was not yelling at him.
Turkey is one of the few Islamic countries which have diplomatic relations with Israel, but for the last few years there has been tension between them.

hl.seg: The attacks were not planned in Pakistan.

doc.seg: Speaking to Indian news channel, NDTV, Wajid Shamsul Hasan, said that the report of the Pakistani investigations into the Mumbai blast will be prepared soon.
In the attacks that took place in Mumbai, last Novemeber, more than 170 persons were killed.
India claims that the responsibility for the attacks belongs to the extremist group, Lashkar-e-Taiba.
India also said that Pakistani 'state factors' were guilty in the Mumbai attacks.
After the Mumbai attacks, the relations between the two countries were affected.
The high commissioner Wajid Shamsul Hasan gave his first statement about the report of the Pakistani investigations, from which it becomes evident as to what is within the report.
Wajid Shamsul Hasan said that as far as investigation has gone, Pakistani land has not been used.
It must be some other place, not England either.
These are the two places (Pakistan and Britain) about which I was worried.
India and the international community have created a lot of pressure on Pakistan to take action against the culprits of the Mumbai attacks.
Wajid Shamsul Haq said: We are not trying to cover it up.
We believe in taking action based on facts.
The world will accept our investigations.
We will try to satisfy India over the results of the investigation.
While defending the delay in the investigation in Pakistan, he said that it takes time to collect, understand and check these kind of things.
High Commissioner Wajid Shamsul Haq said that it took 45 days for India to present its dossier.

hl.seg: A black man elected as the republican leader too.

doc.seg: In the sixth round of elections in the Republican party, Michael Steel has won, receiving 91 votes out of 168.

During the election for the position of chairman of the party, Katen Dawsen, candidate opposite to Steel, was given 70 votes. Whereas, former chairman Dunken abdicated from the competition in the second round.
People say that of the five candidates who ran for the position of the chairmanship of the republican party, Michael Steel was considered the most conservative among them.

After his win, Michael Steel said in his speech "We are saying to our friends and enemies together, come with us, but those who will cause problems in this, be prepared to separate from us." Michael Steel is from Maryland, where he has also been the deputy governor.
He became famous in 2006 when he ran for a seat in the senate.
But after losing in the senate elections he was appointed as the chairman of one political conservative committee of the party.
Now after being selected as the chairman of the party, the efforts of the Republican Party campaign in the entire country will be under his supervision.
He fought elections for this promise that he will give the party a new cause. And that he will use a new technique to join conservative supporters to the party.

hl.seg: Indian claims presence of Lashker-e-Tayyaba and Josh-e-Muhammad in Jammu.

doc.seg: There are reports that terrorists are present in the Poonch tribal area of Jammu.
According to official sources, police and the army surrounded the area and started the search upon receiving secret information.
During this, a fight started in which four militants, two soldiers and one policeman were killed.

According to the sources, fights were going on until the last news broke. In this area, where militants associated with Lashker-e-Tayyaba and Josh-e-Muhammad are present, more soldiers have been sent to fight them.
During this, chief minister Omer Abdullah, nominated by the involved officials, met with the governor. He directly gave the news of the Assembly leader's election from his party national conference.
Congress, the ally of the National Conference, also informed the governor of their advocacy of Omar Abdullah.
Omar Abdullah will take oath as the chief minister of the state.
Remember, the National Conference became the biggest party by gaining 28 seats in the 87 member assembly in the current state elections. Keep in mind that separatist parties boycotted the elections.
Congress, which secured 17 seats, accepted to form a coalition government with the National Conference.
Today, party workers welcomed Omar Abdullah with great fanfare on his arrival in Srinagar.

On this occasion, Omar Abdullah says that he will play his role in making the talks possible between the Indian government and separatists. However, this will not be possible until the elections in India and formation of the new government.

hl.seg: Role of EU for Peace in the Middle East.

doc.seg: From the official point of view, the role of the European Union is decisive in the peace efforts to stop the war in the Middle East.
According to Brussels' official stance, the efforts of Schwarzenberg delegation or Sarkozy were equally helpful in this regard.
The European Union's spokesman, Amadeu Altafaj, has said that every such effort is appreciated which is helpful in sending the European Union's message to the opponents of the war.

As the head of the Union, the Czech Republic's role is even weaker than before.

France has completed its presidential tenure of six months.
Sarkozy wants to play a leading role, and he is capable of it, but he does not have the permission to do so.

He is part of a delegation which is headed by the foreign minister of the Czech Republic, Schwarzenberg.
The problem is that both foreign ministers are issuing contradictory statements over the Middle East war.

Schwarzenberg says that Israel has the right for self defense, whereas Kouchner says that this cannot be considered as a war for self defense. Moreover, Germany has sent its special ambassador to the Middle East. Unless the European Union does not show unity based on common stance it can not succeed on the diplomatic front.
Its proof is the Israeli behavior which does not care about the efforts for reconciliation from the European Union.
This is a golden chance for the European Union to do something since America, due to the policies of George W. Bush, has already failed in the Middle East.

hl.seg: Financial Crisis: Suicide of a billionaire German industrialist.

doc.seg: Adolf Merckle, a resident of Sawabia in Southern Germany, left a huge business group behind him.
But, a short while ago, common German citizens did not know much about it.
When he had to negotiate with 30 banks who lent money to his industrial group, he became the topic of the headlines. Then he could foresee the murky future of the Merckle group.
The Merkle group had to face the loss of a few hundred million euros due to the arrival of the financial crisis after it bought shares in the German car manufacturing company Volkswagen.
Financial institutions then refused to give it the new 700 million to one billion euro loan it needed on an immediate basis, so Merkle was under intense pressure.

Some time before that, the same bank was prepared to give it the immediate loan that it needed, but Adolf Merkel had got to this position from being a small producer, to having a yearly turnover of nearly 30 billion euros, so he could not bear to lose his capitalistic power.
After the death of his father, Adolf Merkel took over his family business and developed it quickly, putting on new lines.
He called his company Ratiopharm, which is a very successful and large pharmaceutical company in Germany.

Until a while ago, the value of this business was between 5 billion and 6 billion euros, and it still earns about 8.1 billion euros a year. After the superb success of Ratiopharm, the Merkel Group started buying many other institutions which included construction supply manufacturing companies like Hydelburg Cement to car manufacturing companies like Kassbohrer.
The number of employees of the Merkel Group around the world is near 100,000, and its foundation company, the pharmaceutical company Ratiopharm, always had special importance.
Adolf Merkel has said many times in his life: "It has been four generations since I started making medicine.
Now the management of this group is in the hands of my children and I hope that the mangement of this company will remain in my family for a few hundred years."

After the suicide of Adolf Merkel, banks have approved 400 million euros in floating loans for his group, but under the condition that VEM will have to sell Ratiopharm so that it could improve its financial conditions in the long term.
After the death of Adolf Meerklay, the Meerklay group will not remain the same.

doc.seg: Ehud Olmert has stressed that for complete evacuation of the army, a future and permanent ceasefire agreement is inevitable.
Hamas and Israel declared ceasefire on Sunday.

At least 1300 Palestinians including 10 soldiers and a total of 13 Israelis were killed in the war lasting for three weeks between the militants of Hamas and Israel.

This man introduces himself as Abu Talha and speaks in German.

on the side of the screen is the logo of Al-Qaida and the date written in the video is October 2008.

hl.seg: Obama has been elected to the American Presidency.

doc.seg: In this situation the whole world - to say nothing of the American public - has different hopes for Obama.
Now that Barack Obama is receiving congratulatory messages from around the world after winning the presidency, expectations of him are also becoming clear.
The German Chancellor, Angela Merchel, also expressed hopes for the new American president.
"I believe that the Joint Republic of Germany and the United States of America will be able to get together on the basis of a strong relationship and partnership to solve the problems facing us."
Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin said that Obama seems like a serious and open-hearted person, qualities he felt were positive.
As such, the previous American president's policies were subject to criticism.

However, the previous administration is definitely credited with persuading China to play a more constructive role on the international level. With regards to the new president, China's leader has said that he will have to work for strong military ties between the countries.
Gosuwe Hu, an expert on Chinese politics active in Bokhum, Germany, says:

From this viewpoint, I am certain that Obama and his economic team will, within the coming weeks and months, pressure the Beijing government into pegging the Chinese currency at a stable and market-representing exchange rate.

About where Obama might take those ties, Professor Christopher Raj, expert on American sciences in New Delhi, says that we are now closer to a strategic partnership, but Obama cannot make any changes overnight.
In his message to Obama, Pope Benedict has stressed peace and co-operation in the world.

hl.seg: Provincial elections in Iraq.

doc.seg: These are the first elections since 2005 in war stricken country.
There are 14400 candidates for 440 seats in provincial elections.
To keep peace during elections 800,000 police and soldiers have been deployed in Iraq.
The borders of Iraq were sealed one day ago, on Friday, because of the threat that a bombing or terror attack can happen on such an important day.
Also, the airports were closed and public transport was forbidden.
According to the news, due to disallowed traffic the roads of Iraq have been deserted and Iraqi children can be seen playing football on roads.

The security situation during recent elections will help in analyzing that after American withdrawal in 2011 whether the local security organizations will be able handle the country or not. On the other hand political analysts are watching this as an experiment with which it can assessed that how much Iraqi people are ready to bring change in the country through democratic way.
Provincial elections are being held in Iraq with the help of United Nations and approximately 800 international correspondents will monitor the elections.

hl.seg: Today, the Day of Aashura, was celebrated throughout Iran in remembrance, respect and honor of the great sacrifice of the chief of all martyrs, Imam Hussain.

doc.seg: According to Mehr news agency, all small and large cities, including the capital city of Tehran witnessed the celebration of this day in the respect of the chief of martyrs, Imam Husain, with great respect and honor. On this occasion, the believers gathered in great numbers. In such honorary gatherings, the people also remembered the deaths of the Holy Prophet (PBUH) and his family members. Today, the whole country of Iran is mourning the great sacrifice of the martyrdom of the Prophet's grandson, Imam Hussain, in the battle field of Karbala. hl.seg: Barack Obama: America will try a new policy in Iran.

He said that there is a dilemma with regard to Palestinian Islamic organizations Hamas and Hizbullah's support of Iran and Iran's nuclear enrichment program.

Barack Obama said that he would make his actual goal completely clear, while stressing the hope for mutual respect and dialogue.
Barack Obama has mentioned in the past that no prerequisites will be set with regard to dialogue with Iran.
During the interview, he expressed hope that his government would make quick policy decisions on Iran.
Regarding the Middle East crisis, Obama said that he would form a special team.
It will start working on establishing peace in the Middle East from the 20th of January.

doc.seg: According to a report by Mehr News Agency, Usamah Hamdan, the Hamas leader in Lebanon, told French News Agency during an interview that a one-sided ceasefire from the Israeli side is against the comprehensive international efforts for a ceasefire. hl.seg: Taliban have killed six people in Pakistan's tribal area of north Wazirastan.

hl.seg: Murder of Balochistan merchants in Karachi, Complete strike in Quetta

doc.seg: Due to the death of four merchants from Balochistan in Karachi, a complete strike was in effect on Thursday against it, in Quetta and some other places.
In this period all business centers remained closed, whereas traffic was also less than usual.

The strike was called by the "Anjuman Tajiran Balochistan" (Balochistan Trade Union), Pushtunkhwah Milli Awami Party and the Jamiat-e-Ulama-e-Islam. They accused the Karachi police of having openly fired at these merchants, when they were going by car to their vehicle showroom on Tariq Road.
The president of the Anjuman Tajiran, Abdur Raheem Kakad, demanded that the guilty police agents should be arrested and action should be taken against them.
However, the stance of the Karachi police regarding this incident was not immediately clear.
All four of the dead merchants were from the border city of Chaman.

hl.seg: A senior commander of Hamas was killed in Israeli attack.

doc.seg: In an air attack by Israel, a senior Hamas commander was killed.
This is the second death of an important Hamas figure, in the week-long Israeli attacks on the Gaza belt.
Hamas officeholders said that Abu Zakariyya AlJamaal was killed in Shujaaiyah palace in the east of Gaza city on Saturday.

hl.seg: Israeli attacks on Gaza continue on the tenth day.

hl.seg: Tea may help prevent breast cancer

doc.seg: According to new research, drinking three cups of tea every day
the risk for breast cancer is reduced by more than one third in women under 50 years old.
Research conducted by the MOFT center in Florida, USA, has found that women under 50 years age that have breast cancer genes
The risk of breast cancer is reduced by 37 percent in women who drink three cups of tea per day.
The research shows that women over 50 years of age do not see any benefit from drinking three or more cups of tea a day.
The researchers think that for women under 50, the tea contains elements that are effective against the genes that cause breast cancer.
Research was done on 5000 women who had Breast Cancer treatment at Moffitt Cancer Center in Tampa,Florida.
Their ages were between 20 and 74 years.
Specialists compared their medical records and lifestyles to those women who were free of breast cancer.
Specialists also found that tea had the most effect on one specific kind of breast cancer, Lobes. It reduced the risk by 66%.
One on every ten breast cancer patients has this kind of cancer.
This type of breast cancer is dangerous because it is deep inside and usually only diagnosed when it has become widespread.
Specialists found that having at least three cups of tea every day can readily reduce the chances of breast cancer in women of younger ages.
They found that incorporating tea as a regular drink in your daily routine helps create immunity against the cancer.
Almost 40,000 women are diagnosed with breast cancer in Britain.

hl.seg: Why Reduce Exercise With Age?
New Research

doc.seg: Exercise at any age is good for your health.
It energizes your heart, reduces cholesterol levels, helps in keeping weight low, helps to prevent diabetes and slows down the process of Alzheimer's or dementia.
Unfortunately the ability to exercise decreases for many people as they age.
Experts say that exercise keeps our body and brain active however age can affect it.
According to the American Medical Association, several health related problems can arise from not doing exercise.
Dr. Pattricia P. Leka of the Mayo Clinic in Minnesota says that increase in age is a big reason for being handicapped from exercise and other physical activity.
Dr. Patricia teaches medicine at Mayo clinic.
She headed a research study regarding heart disease and man's ability to do exercise in older age.
A team of doctors used high frequency sound waves to observe the performance of heart
in which it's activity of pumping blood and its contraction and relaxation was studied.
Researcher focused their attention on the right side of the heart, which is the main part of pumping blood.
They came to know ,that with increase in age, problems increase in the relaxation action of heart.
Dr. Patricia says with increase in age, problems occur in the activity of relaxation of heart and this effects the ability to exercise.
Dr. Garvin Ken was also part of this research.
He says that they were surprised to see that it has an effect and it confirmed that bad exercising ability is very much related to the heart relaxing activity.
Sometimes blood pressure can cause disorders in heart functions and heart disease.
If the doctor and the patient work in tandem in this regard, the patient can take advantage of the benefits of exercise regardless of age.
A detailed report on this matter is published in a magazine from the American Medical Association.
